column5: SYDNEY  Nov 22 The safe-haven U.S. dollar stayed well bid in Asia on Tuesday following a sharp pullback in global risk appetite as the sovereign debt storm intensified on both sides of the Atlantic.

column4: UPDATE 4-Moody's warns on French rating outlook
column5: * Moody's says threat is to outlook  not rating at this stage

column4: Moody's warns on French rating outlook
column5: PARIS Moody's warned France on Monday that a sustained rise in its debt yields coupled with weakening economic growth could harm its ratings outlook  fuelling concern the euro zone's second largest economy might lose its coveted AAA status.

column4: BRIEF-Moody's:No rating impact on J.G. Wentworth structured settlement ABS
column5: * Moody's: No rating impact on J.G. Wentworth structured settlement ABS following execution of amended Intercreditor Agreement

column4: French fin min says financing at favourable levels
column5: PARIS  Nov 21 Finance Minister Francois Baroin said on Monday that France's cost of financing remained at "very favourable" levels  after Moody's warned a sustained rise could hurt France's credit outlook.

column4: CORRECTED- Juncker says eurobonds not absurdity
column5: MAINZ  Germany  Nov 21 Eurogroup head Jean-Claude Juncker on Monday spoke out against a possible downgrading of France by ratings agency Moody's  saying that would be inappropriate considering the country's actual fiscal condition.

column4: Debt jitters drive Britain's FTSE sharply lower
column5: LONDON  Nov 21 Britain's top shares sank to six-week lows on Monday as a U.S. committee looked set to miss a deficit reduction deadline and a ratings agency warning on France compounded worries about the euro zone debt crisis.

column4: Moody's: debt cost may be negative for France rating
column5: PARIS  Nov 21 Ratings agency Moody's said that a recent rise in interest rates on French government debt and weaker economic growth prospects could be negative for France's credit rating.

column4: Analysis: Wall St. banks wonder if they are shrinking for good
column5: NEW YORK Wall Street bankers are used to vicious swings in fortunes - it is in their DNA. Make a killing in the good times  they say  because markets may turn against you tomorrow.

column4: Oshkosh urges anti-Icahn vote; CEO declines raise
column5: Nov 21 Oshkosh Corp's board of directors has told shareholders to "disregard" an opposition proxy statement from Carl Icahn  setting up a potential battle between the Wisconsin-based truck maker and the billionaire investor at the company's upcoming annual meeting.

column4: Pearson to buy English teaching firm in China
column5: LONDON British publishing group Pearson Plc  agreed to buy China's Global Education and Technology Group   which prepares students for English-language tests  for $155 million in cash  extending its reach in China from eight cities to 60.

column4: UPDATE 2-Pearson to buy English teaching firm in China
column5: * Global Education owns or franchises 450 centres in China

column4: UPDATE 1-Pfizer to settle US charges for over $60 mln-WSJ
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 20 Pfizer Inc has agreed to pay more than $60 million to settle an investigation by U.S. regulators into whether the drugmaker paid bribes to win business abroad  The Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 2-Philip Morris challenges Australia on plain pack tobacco
column5: * Govt braces for court action against plain pack tobacco laws

column4: Philip Morris challenges Australia on plain pack
column5: CANBERRA Tobacco giant Philip Morris on Monday launched legal action against Australian laws forcing tobacco products to be sold in drab  plain packaging from late next year.

column4: Philip Morris launches action against Australia tobacco laws
column5: CANBERRA  Nov 21 Tobacco giant Philip Morris said on Monday it was launching legal action against Australian laws passed by parliament forcing tobacco products to be sold in drab  plain packaging from late next year.

column4: REFILE-Abu Dhabi's TAQA sets tender offer for $1.5 bln 2012 bond
column5: DUBAI  Nov 21 Abu Dhabi National Energy Co (TAQA) has launched a tender offer for its $1.5 billion bond maturing 2012 and mandated four banks for a new bond issue to partly refinance the existing debt maturity.

column4: Debt jitters drive Britain's FTSE sharply lower
column5: LONDON  Nov 21 Britain's top shares sank to six-week lows on Monday as a U.S. committee looked set to miss a deficit reduction deadline and a ratings agency warning on France compounded worries about the euro zone debt crisis.

column4: S&P downgrades Clearwire debt by a notch
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 21 Standard & Poors Corp on Monday downgraded Clearwire Corp's credit rating by one notch to 'CCC' with a "developing outlook" due to concerns that it may skip interest payments due on Dec. 1.

column4: Centrica buys $1.63 billion Norwegian upstream assets
column5: OSLO The UK's Centrica  boosted its oil and gas production by a quarter on Monday through buying a string of assets from Norway's Statoil  and signing a 10-year gas deal that will improve the UK's energy security.

column4: UPDATE 3-Centrica buys $1.63 bln Norwegian upstream assets
column5: OSLO  Nov 21 The UK's Centrica  boosted its oil and gas production by a quarter on Monday through buying a string of assets from Norway's Statoil  and signing a 10-year gas deal that will improve the UK's energy security.

column4: Statoil gets stake in Indonesian exploration block
column5: OSLO  Nov 21 Norwegian oil group Statoil  was awarded an 80 percent working interest and the operatorship in the Halmahera II block  a large offshore oil and gas exploration licence in eastern Indonesia  the company said on Monday.

column4: Statoil sells field stakes off Norway to UK's Centrica
column5: OSLO  Nov 21 Norway's Statoil has agreed to sell interests in eight fields and prospects off Norway to UK-based energy company Centrica for $1.63 billion  it said on Monday.

column4: Suncor reports minor leak at Sarnia  Ontario refinery
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 21 Suncor Energy Inc.  reported a minor leak in a naphtha unit at its 85 000 barrel per day refinery in Sarnia  Ontario  according to a community information alert.     The leak occurred late Sunday evening and warning sirens were activated for southern Sarnia  Aamjiwnaang First Nation and Northern St. Clair.  An all clear sounded early Monday morning.     Onsite crew responded to the leak which was reported to minor but further information on the type and quantity is n

column4: Chains brace for season of holiday discounts
column5: Retailers trying to woo shoppers with early deals and longer hours this week  and throughout the holiday season  could be putting their profits at risk as shoppers search for bargains and not much else.

column4: PREVIEW-UPDATE 1-US chains brace for season of holiday discounts
column5: * Retail stocks have outperformed broad market this month

column4: Telefonica signs network pact with China Unicom
column5: MADRID  Nov 21 Spain's Telefonica  said it had signed an agreement with peer China Unicom  to use each other's networks to expand their coverage.

column4: Ex-Schwab exec settles with SEC in YieldPlus case
column5: Nov 21 A former president at Charles Schwab Corp's investment management unit will pay a $150 000 civil fine to resolve a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission lawsuit accusing him of hiding from investors the risks in the multibillion-dollar YieldPlus mutual fund.

column4: Canada oil sector must keep cleaning up act: Prentice
column5: CALGARY  Alberta The U.S.-imposed delay of TransCanada Corp's Keystone XL oil pipeline shows Canada's energy industry cannot relax efforts to improve its environmental record  a former top minister in Prime Minister Stephen Harper's government said on Monday.

column4: Tyson profit misses estimate; costs seen rising
column5: Tyson Foods Inc   the largest U.S. meat processor  reported a lower-than-expected quarterly profit on higher grain and feed costs and said it expected them to keep rising this fiscal year.

column4: UPDATE 2-Tyson profit misses estimate; costs seen rising
column5: Nov 21 Tyson Foods Inc   the largest U.S. meat processor  reported a lower-than-expected quarterly profit on higher grain and feed costs and said it expected them to keep rising this fiscal year.

column4: UPDATE 1-Valeant says to buy Australia's iNova for $623 mln
column5: MELBOURNE  Nov 21 Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc said it agreed to buy Australia's iNova Pharmaceuticals from private equity firms Archer Capital and Ironbridge for A$625 million ($623 million) upfront.

column4: Alleghany to buy Transatlantic for $3.4 billion
column5: U.S. property and casualty insurer Alleghany Corp  said on Monday it would buy reinsurer Transatlantic Holdings Inc  for $3.4 billion in cash and stock -- though a sharp drop in Alleghany shares meant a separate  hostile bid for Transatlantic was at least temporarily more valuable.

column4: UPDATE 6-Alleghany to buy Transatlantic for $3.4 bln
column5: Nov 21 U.S. property and casualty insurer Alleghany Corp said on Monday it would buy reinsurer Transatlantic Holdings Inc for $3.4 billion in cash and stock -- though a sharp drop in Alleghany shares meant a separate  hostile bid for Transatlantic was at least temporarily more valuable.

column4: TIMELINE-Bidding race for reinsurer Transatlantic
column5: Nov 21 U.S. property and casualty insurer Alleghany Corp snapped up Transatlantic Holdings  for $3.4 billion in cash and stock  a move that may help the Bermuda-based reinsurer ward off a hostile bid from rival Validus Holdings Ltd.

column4: UPDATE 2-Alleghany near $3.4 bln Transatlantic deal-source
column5: * Alleghany set to pay $59-$60 per share in cash and stock

column4: UPDATE 2-Silvercorp to buy China's SX Gold for $23 mln
column5: Nov 21 Silvercorp Metals Inc said on Monday it will buy China's SX Gold Mining Company for about $23 million  in a move aimed at consolidating its holdings in China's Henan province.
